author: Extremely grateful mum
title: We are so appreciative of everyone’s support
body:
My son has been supported by this great team since he was weeks old. He has been assisted by several different OTs, Physios and SALTS, one amazing OT Assistant Practitioner and a wonderful dietician.  
Whenever we have a question or a worry there is always someone there to reassure us and problem solve. This has been particularly important right now at a time of transition. We are so appreciative of everyone’s support.  
My son would not be the boy he is today without the support of each therapist. Throughout covid several supported his therapy over Nearme. His SALT, Jenny, held weekly sessions to progress his communication and feeding. His Dietician, Caroline, kept a very close eye on his weight and was a huge support during an extremely worrying time.  
Once covid restrictions lifted Morag, his physio, came swimming with us to teach us how to deliver hydrotherapy. And Tracey, Assistant OT Practitioner, has worked so hard with our son and the whole family since he was months old. She has brought out the best in him. He adores her and she has been an incredible support to us all. She is a credit to NHS Tayside!

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Sam03
title: Beyond angry with the way we have been treated
body:
I'm absolutely disgusted by the way me and my husband have been treated today. My husband is having tests for cancer after finding 2 lumps in unusual places from the GP. He has had high BP for the past 3 days and we were advised by our own GP if it's constant for 3 days to seek more medical advice. Which we did this morning when my husband's BP went to 184/125!  
Upon arrival at urgent walk-in care, we were greeted by a member of staff who was aggressive and quiet frankly rude because I was with my husband. I explained due to my husband having learning disabilities I needed to be with him when he's speaking to someone as he doesn't understand. After agreeing it was OK for me to stay, as soon as he was called in another member of staff stopped me from entering and following my husband. Again I explained, only this time the member of staff was rude and refused to let me in! After his obs was done 4 TIMES due to how high his BP was, he was then referred urgently to A&E!  
We waited an hour to be seen (fair enough, I get they're busy).  
To then have to have my husband sit in a corridor with around 9 other patients, all told to get their arms out ready for BP to be done again, which quite frankly again I was disgusted with how lack of dignity all these patients was receiving!  
We finally went in to see a nurse, who was more interested in talking out the door to another doctor, openly talking about other patients directly in front of us! They were rude, unhelpful and uncaring. Everything we told them about my husband waiting on cancer tests and scans and his high blood pressure and dizzy spells and being told to go straight to A&E to get seen,they took it on theirself to huff and moan about how it's a GP matter and how we shouldn't be in A&E. Even though we were referred there! The nurse made us feel so unwelcome, and how rude they were I was fuming by the time we left the room. They were very unprofessional and rude.  
We were then transferred to upstairs same day emergency care. Again, having to explain my husband has learning difficulties so I'd like to stay with him so I can fully understand what's being said as my husband won't. To then have yet another RUDE member of staff kick me out the department and told me to wait downstairs!  
So I then had to leave my sick husband with very high hypertensive stage 3 blood pressure on his own to attempt to explain to a doctor what's been going on (which he physically won't be able to do).  
I'm beyond angry with the way they have treated him and me. And we still haven't had any care of dignity throughout the entire experience. My husband is still waiting on a doctor to see him!

author: virgomum77
title: Cannot fault anything
body: I fell in early December and broke my wrist. I have received excellent care from everyone I have seen - from minor injuries, to everyone in the orthopedic department at Larbert. I got my cast off today and will receive physio moving forward. Cannot fault anything.

title: Brilliant
body:
Attended A and E with my Mum who has dementia 
All staff extremely kind and caring at all times 
Only down side corridor waiting so Mum upset when someone was shouting 
There 6.5 hours in total 
Thank you all

title: So much care given
body:
My Husband was on ward 34 were he received the best care, Nurses and Doctor s could not do enough for my Husband
Unfortunate he passed away
But a big thank you to all the staff who cared for him

title: Brilliant Practice
body: I do find it hard to get through to the practice by phone, but as I only live a few minutes away I can call in, find the receptionists polite  and helpful, Doctors are understanding and found my questions were answered and everything was explained in great detail

title: Kind and helpful personnel
body: Very professional staff with a kind attitude, that solves all issues efficiently. It was a relief to be listened and helped so quickly. Thank you!

author: Cloughreagh
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My stay was very positive
body: My stay was very positive, I gained confidence with my mobility and doing my catheter care myself. I enjoyed my stay very much and the staff were really good, nothing was too much trouble for them. The only thing I would have liked was longer visiting hours in the evening, as my family had to travel a good distance to visit me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service
body: Hello all, I've experienced wonderful service from this practice, of an exemplary nature - from reception team to clinicians. Regards !

title: Great practice
body: I requested a phone call with the nurse for a medical problem. She phoned back, listened and gave me same day appointment. Quick and easy.

author: Patricia63
title: Sleep clinic - no one is answering the phone
body: I have sleep apnea and my cpap mask keeps leaking air so is unusable. I have been trying to contact them for a new face mask but no one is answering the phone. I have rang at different times during the day. I'm not complaining, I just need another mask, I have been without one for several days. Could I just add that the staff in the sleep lab are amazing.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Efficient Service
body: Having moved into the area just over a year ago, this was my first experience of getting doctors appointment. I had a telephone consultation which was all I needed, and the doctor immediately offered treatment which dealt with my symptoms.

title: Great GP
body: In such a big surgery the personal touch could be ignored. It’s so nice to have a doctor who actually listens and always does her best for me. I couldn’t ask for anything more.

title: Excellent Practice
body: I rang the surgery this morning and a very nice receptionist answered the phone. I explained that I needed an appointment today and she was able to give me an appointment today.

title: Very satisfied patient of this great practice
body: Throughout the pandemic and even with the current pressures on the NHS, from my experience,  the Medwyn practice continues to offer a great service to its patients.  I particularly like the online form to concisely describe the nature of the illness and any concerns when seeking treatment.  It has always been followed up with a prompt initial diagnosis telephone call and then a timely face-to-face appointment if required. All of the team work together to put the patient's needs first.  This combined with an on-site pharmacy next door with extended opening hours makes this a great facility.

title: Great experience
body:
Great doctors and nurse, always tried to help me.
Reception very helpful as well, had an appointment for my son, early in the morning because of the school, booked me without any problems. Very happy with the results.

title: Excellent practice
body: We have been with Medwyn for 28 years and have always been very grateful for the standard of service provided in terms of accessibility, care, friendliness, helpfulness and the physical environment. This occasion was no different from that just described.

author: charaqm95
title: Positive and cheery nurse
body: I have just come out of an appointment for my seven-year-old daughter in the pediatric department for wound aftercare. We would just like to say a thank you to the nurse on duty that saw us. She was so lovely and reassured both myself and my daughter. She was so pleasant and cheery and we had such a good experience that I just wanted to give feedback and say how positive the experience was.

title: Best practice for miles
body: We’re always quickly attended too, great service and care. We always hear such negative things about other practices from other people but we really can’t complain about ours, they are just brilliant. Super organised and efficient too.

title: Fantastic staff
body: I was in A&E on Wednesday and the care and tests off all staff brilliant, I was kept in and informed all the way big thank you

title: Lovely staff in all departments...
body:
We are all a bit nervous when we have to go to hospital, aren't we? No need! What a lovely, friendly, kind helpful bunch of people in Ward F, at Ormskirk hospital.  
I was in for minor surgery, and felt very much at ease from walking through the door. The nurses, consultants, anaesthetist and doctor were just lovely, explaining everything to me and I cannot thank you enough. I even had a giggle with the anaesthetic and surgery team prior to going into surgery. They were lovely. 
And when I left the ward I was waved off like a friend. 
I'm due for a second surgery at some point and I'm actually looking forward to going back! 

Thankyou so much everyone, you have left a lasting impression and I won't forget any of you. I do hope you all get chance to read this review xx

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: Exemplary medical staff under great pressure.
body:
I was referred to A&E from NHS helpline. From arrival I was treat with respect, courtesy and professionalism. I was shocked by the number of patients the department was coping with and throughout a long wait I saw staff working tirelessly. The junior doctor I saw was thorough and apologetic for the wait when he had no control over this. He and all his colleagues are doing a great job in an underfunded and understaffed service.
Well done.

author: capellanp43
title: They have been outstanding
body:
Just to say thank you to both the hospital and my GP surgery for the attention to detail following my repair surgery and subsequent physiotherapy appointments.  
I am very pleased with everything being done so far.  
Special praise to my GP surgery, they have been outstanding.

title: Telephone appointment experience
body: Call came from practice around 2 hours later than it was advised, but overruns at the end of the day must be expected. Once on the call, the doctor delivered my scan results and revised my questionnaire and delivered a new prescription based on the consultation. She then gave full answers to my remaining questions, some not connected with the main reason for the consultation. I was impressed by the time and attention given to me by the doctor despite the fact that she was probably running late on a long shift.

title: Great practice
body: Lovely team , prompt appointment  and a professional environment.  I was seen on weekend which it was great for me as I am working ,appointment was given very soon as my problem was urgent !

title: Excellent care
body: Treated with kindness and efficiency during endoscopy, during difficult times. All my anxieties were understood  and the whole procedure was carried out with care and attention to me as a first time patient. For my follow up endoscopy I will not feel like ‘a rabbit caught in the headlights’, thanks to your lovely team.  Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Timely and compassionate care
body: Had to visit the practice this week and was cared for with kindness and professionalism by all I came in to contact with. Reception staff and practice nurse and trainee were courteous and ensured I got the care that I needed. Thank you.

author: Steve20
title: Personal health care
body:
I had been de-registered as a patient at a local doctors so I sought the advice of the Minor Injuries Unit in Arbroath. On hearing my plight, the nurses went about helping me get the attention I needed. They listened to what was wrong with me, then worked out the best way to help me, seeing as there was no doctor on site.  
They carried out an examination and gradually determined what was the best way forward. They carried out blood tests to determine if the problem was a blood clot or any other medical issues. It turns out the nurses' first thoughts were correct and led to further investigation.  
The nurses managed to find me another doctors surgery to register at. I was given two prescriptions along with the new doctors surgery to register at. The blood tests came back positive and needing a further ultrasound scan, which identified a blood clot at the back of my lower leg.  
I am now under the supervision of a doctor at the hospital and a new surgery. The nurses went above and beyond their title of minor injuries and illness to ensure I received the treatment I was needing. I cannot thank the whole unit enough and how they are a very important part of the local community.

author: indigocp84
title: The care I get every appointment is very good
body: I am here in the clinic today (fracture clinic) as I have a follow up appointment following a fracture of my leg. The care I get every appointment is very good, cannot fault any of the girls treating me as they have been 100% also very funny at times great banter in the fracture clinic! The staff have all been amazing but I would like to thank Laura of the fracture clinic, who has been with me from the moment I had the cast on the leg and she has been in every appointment I attend, feel as if there are no silly questions when talking to her and gives great advice!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: andromedatr84
title: Lots of care and attention
body: So far my time is a positive one as I feel I am being treated with a lot of care and attention. What is great with this ward is that there is always someone to talk to when I needed help. The doctors on ward are amazing, there is a young male doctor whose name I cannot remember apologies but he is very good for someone who is only starting out, he is very compassionate which not a lot of doctors that t I have come across can present this but he does it so well very mannerly toward us elderly and professional. He follows my case personally and gives a lot of time to patients. The nursing staff on ward are also wonderful and they try their best to get patients' needs!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hekahb95
title: Orthopedic Ward
body: I came into this ward roughly 3 days ago and so far everything has been very good. The staff have been treating me with the upmost respect and I have been getting the best recovery while I have been in here. My wife has been coming in everyday to me and has gotten on with all the staff members and even she says there is not one that isn’t friendly. They will all take the time to ask me how I am doing and talk away to me, the staff offer more craic than the TV, full of laughs so they are. My bed has been quite uncomfortable but I understand that they are standard hospital beds and I will be looking forward to getting back to my own.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hadarbf75
title: I was even treated to a song
body: I attended the vanguard unit at Hairmyres Hospital for a Colonoscopy today, to say I was nervous is an understatement. However the staff were amazing, couldn’t do enough for me. I was even treated to a song from one of the staff.

author: pepperzt36
title: Helped to put my mind at rest so many times
body:
Long Covid for me has been horrendous, I thought that over a year later I’d have been back to work and have some sort of normality. I used to work up to 60 hours a week, now I’m sitting in front of the TV and every day feels like 60 hours! I feel like Covid has stolen my life from me, my health, my friends, and might even take my job from me later this year. It’s put a strain on my marriage, as my wife’s life has changed in many ways too, she looks after me before she does anything else.  
A year later I’m still on oxygen and left with a number of other health concerns. I’m not bed ridden, I’m not housebound, but a day out for me at the minute is me walking round Tesco with my wife and the oxygen bottle in the trolley. It makes me feel sad when I know where I was and were I am now.  
I got discharged from hospital, I was seen by the respiratory nurse a couple of times. She referred me to have a chat with somebody and I was lucky enough to get Elaine.  
I am so thankful for speaking to Elaine! I couldn’t thank her enough! She put my mind at rest, she put names to things that I was going through like delirium, I didn’t know what it was till I spoke to her. I had nobody to talk to, it seemed no one understood. I was feeling anxious, frustrated, confused and frightened. I couldn’t see the light at the end of the tunnel. When I was in hospital I felt I had a big safety net, when I got home I didn’t have that.  
Talking to Elaine helped to put my mind at rest so many times. She was able to tell me other people were going through similar things, this reassured me I wasn’t on my own. When I told her I thought I was on boats, in war zones, etc with delirium she was able to tell me other people had experience of that too. Elaine is very good at what she does, there were times were I laughed and cried. I wanted someone to help untangle the knot I had in my head, she mightn’t have untangled it fully but she loosened it. She was wonderful, I couldn’t sing her praises high enough.  
I still can see faces and visualise people who I think were looking after me in ICU, due to delirium these people might not even exist because I never actually saw their faces: they were masked up. I can only remember one name: Oran. I don’t know who he was. I would like to go to ICU and meet the people who did so much for me, (they saved my life) and say thank you.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Service User FV
title: Responsive, professional, patient-centred care
body:
This is general feedback for our local practice. They now have a very good system for answering calls. Automated advice on answering signposts patients to the relevant professionals - i.e. teeth/dentist; eyes/optician, etc. Then the automated system tells you where you are in the queue. Helpful. Easier to hold if one knows it will be your turn soon. Very responsive, professional, patient-centred care offered.  
I would like to specifically mention Dr Mitchell, who in my experience and that of family members is extremely thorough, patient-centred, efficient, professional, respectful and friendly too.  
The practice also offers Well Person appointments for those who wish to be more proactive about their health. An early intervention/prevention approach, helping patients as well as hopefully saving NHS resource - i.e. by dealing with potential issues before they become more serious and have higher resource implications.  
The NHS is expected to operate within finite resources, not knowing who is going to walk through their doors with what ailment. Extremely challenging. Applaud the NHS for the job they do often in very difficult circumstances. Thank you!

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: Pola
title: Issue with USG
body:
I am writing in respect of USG at Stobhill Hospital.  
I was earlier on USG in Poland, where a lump in my left breast was visible, then on my visit in Stobhill Hospital, I was told that the technician didn't see anything and there is nothing in my breast. I went again for USG in Poland, where this lump was visible still.  
This is outrageous! If there is something wrong with the USG machine or the technician operating it is under-educated, this should be resolved asap. What about other women, who can't go to better clinic for proper examination? What if they are told that there is nothing in their breast, and they really have a cancer?  
I was trying to raise that with them, because this is very big issue, but I was sent to my GP. I have no idea why, as this is not their issue, but the hospital's.  
This should be looked into, and if you require some more information, please let me know.  
Kind regards.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male Medical has been good
body:
I have been in since last Friday. I came to ED and had about a 14 hour wait In ED. I have been in male medical ever since. The staff up here are excellent. Clean sheets every morning. The ward is always spotless.  
The nurses and health care assistants are brilliant. The doctors have been good. I did feel like they weren’t listening to me and what I was trying to say. But they are the professionals. They are all stretched to the limit and try their best.  
The food is good. I love the porridge and banana. I look forward to breakfast in the mornings. Fills me up for the day!  
Everything has been very good but I’ll be glad to get home to my own bed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ariesjp75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I don’t think much of the food
body:
I came to ED on Monday, I got a bed in ED and spent 1 day and night down there. I was made very comfortable and was very well cared for by the staff in ED. They are fantastic. Very kind and very helpful.  
I don’t think much of the food if I am being truthfully honest. I had the gammon today and it was just like wrinkly sliced ham from a sandwich. A bit of toast in the morning also wouldn’t go amiss. They give me porridge every morning and I don’t like porridge. I stayed here 4 years ago and the food was much better back then.  
The ward is nice and clean. It’s warm and spacious.  
The staff are excellent. The doctors are great. They are very informative, happy to answer any questions I have.  
Everything has been great except for the food.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Top tier staff
body:
My experience of Female Surgical in Daisy Hill has been great. The staff are fantastic. They can’t do enough for you. I found it a bit strange when I heard I was going to Female Surgical when I was a male, but from the minute I arrived it didn’t feel bizarre or uncomfortable at all. If anything, you’re just grateful to be getting the right care. And the ward is grand. It’s a good laugh at times.  
The doctors are top tier! They are very good.  
The food's nice. I’m sure some people don’t like it, but I really don’t mind it. I like the curry.  
It’s been a good stay for being in hospital. Obviously I am looking forward to getting home, but it’s been a relaxing stay and maybe what my body needed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mileymile
title: Supported and motivated to change
body:
I was very ill with my mental health and felt no one can help me, and my nurse told me about getting support for working. I had been out of work a few years so was not hopeful, but then Debbie came along. I was very negative about mental health service I have experienced over the years and did not want to take my tablets, I honestly thought she would be just in it for a job and did not care.  
I was very wrong, the first thing she did is give me a talking to, which I needed, she was gentle with the talking to. But she said if I was to continue not working with my nurse and not taking my tablets, then what in fact would change. I don't want to make Debs sound harsh, as she was not, but she was very honest. Debs motivated me to change, she supported me at jobs fairs, which previously due to my anxiety would not have been possible, she supported me in my claim for pip, she did a CV, she helped me see I was not a write-off, still not sure how she did it.  
I did take my tablets and worked with my nurse and doctor, and things did start to improve, not perfect but getting better. I still have up days and down and dark days, but due to the job I got in a school with Deb it allowed me to feel I have some use. I am just finishing up as my circumstances mean I am also becoming a paid carer for my dad, which Deb also supported me to get.  
I would recommend this lady, she has been more proactive in my getting better from all the mental health illness than any qualified nurse. Even if you think you can't do it, Debbie's down to earth, balanced attitude will help, so ask your nurse or doctor. Debs also has a great sense of humor and makes tedious tasks seem fun, I will keep in touch with her as I know she always likes to hear about my progress, she truly cares.  
Thanks my life changed forever.  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Finding your way']

author: footballny57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I would like to mention all the ambulatory doctors and nurses
body:
I am in Craigavon Area Hospital as I have just had my first knee replacement surgery. The care I received from all the staff surgeons, anaesthetist, nurses, physios, and recovery team was exceptional, they all went above and beyond for me.  
I was in Craigavon before due to an infection I had and was previously on 3 North, the staff was amazing then and they still are amazing now!  
I would like to mention all the ambulatory doctors and nurses whose reassurance helped me enormously, the department is just brilliant from first arriving in till now, they have been so attentive.  
I would also like to praise Lauren for her aftercare and attention. My care during times of being here have been excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: braceyy87
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A real credit to the department
body: I was dealt with today by Karen and Aimee in the Ambulatory Care Team. They were both very personable and thorough with their care. Both were very professional and provided a high level of service. They are a real credit to the department have made me feel as comfortable as possible from my time being in here. I am blown away by the care I received and the obvious dedication to this very challenging job. You can tell the staff in this department are professional and passionate when it comes to their job, I am entirely cared for during my short stay here. Thank you all so very much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: corvusyd43
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The treatment is very good
body: I have been a patient on the 2 South Ward here in Craigavon Area Hospital for a couple days now following a stroke I recently had. It was a very scary moment when it happened to me as this is the first time, but I was very lucky it wasn’t a major one. The treatment is very good and so far everything is going smoothly, the standard of care I have been receiving is very good. I am most impressed with the friendly nursing staff, as nothing was ever too much trouble for them. The one thing that is a downfall is that my diet has to change, the food variety is limited for me, other than that nothing could have been better. Thank you to everybody who treated me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jainey
title: Exception care and treatment from the whole team
body:
Thank you !  
There aren’t adequate words to express my gratitude for all the excellent and timely health treatment I’ve received at Raigmore Hospital over the last year. My local Munlochy surgery doctor acted so speedily when I saw her with some (to me) unusual symptoms last January - the response from the hospital was equally speedy.  
Within two weeks I was at the beginning of a process of tests, examination, diagnosis, booking for a hysterectomy (over Easter weekend) and then just a few weeks later on to a course of chemotherapy. I’m now emerging out the other end regaining energy, feeling very well and so thankful.  
Throughout the entire experience I have been highly aware of the care, compassion, professional skill and expertise of every single person I encountered, and am still encountering as follow up continues. From cleaner to consultant, every role in between, and all the different departments: gynaecology, radiology, surgeon, anaesthetist and surgery team, Ward 4a, medical science, the MacMillan Suite, and the Maggie’s Centre. And all happening in the face of the constraints and challenges they faced daily and still do - with Covid and staffing pressures.  
They are all exceptional.

title: Staff were amazing
body: I encountered numerous staff during my time here and each and everyone was friendly, caring, smiling and comforting. This made my experience here much more comfortable and I appreciate the help each and every member of staff gave me as I know it's not easy working long hours and giving everyone the same level of care. I want to thank the staff sincerely.

title: Excellent service
body:
Managed to get an appointment at short notice.
Saw nurse at appointment time 
Very professional. Explained things in clear and concise way

author: Felse45
title: Cancelled appointment
body:
I am totally disgusted at the treatment that I received as I had an appointment booked and a taxi at a cost of twenty pounds to get me there, but on arrival I was informed that the appointment had been cancelled.  
I accept that I received a phone call on my mobile, but as I was in the garden it rang off before I could get to it and as it said Good Hope Hospital attempted to ring the number back twelve times over subsequent days, but the phone just cut off without even a ringing sound, so I resorted to the land line and when I eventually got through to appointments I was 26th in the queue, so I gave up on it.  
I have confirmation on my mobile that Monday was the one and only attempt you made, whereas my twelve attempts were logged and I checked my landline and there was no attempt whatsoever on there to contact me.  
Strangely enough, since Covid we have not left the house as our daughter and granddaughter tend to all our needs, no matter what they might be, so you must admit that I have a justified complaint at my treatment and why I feel so terribly annoyed and out of pocket to a serious amount to an OAP and I feel at the very least I should be remunerated.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: So helpful
body: Honestly the service at the GP is exceptional. The front of desk ladies are always happy to help and polite. Both doctors I have seen in the last week have got me in straight away, listened to my problems and referred me on straight away. Both have explained things in detail and have given me reassurance. So thank you the whole team do a great job x

title: Great practice
body: We are very happy with Medwyn Surgery.  We like their online system which allows us to explain our problem and requirements knowing that we will receive a response within a few hours probably with an appointment to either meet a doctor or receive a telephone call.

author: redyy43
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All have done a wonderful job!
body:
During a football match I manage to fracture my wrist and was advised to come to Craigavon ED. From ED I was brought to the fracture clinic. I wasn't sure if it was the right place to go, because I felt that it wasn’t signed too well and staff could have directed me where to go.  
However, the nurse who assessed me in the fracture clinic was fantastic. She is just amazing at her job treated me very well. I am so grateful to all of them for the kindness and skill they showed in treating me. I would like to thank all the staff at the fracture clinic, and from orthopaedics and the theatre staff and the triage nurse. All have done a wonderful job!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Awful Receptionist
body: I have just registered for this practice, called to book an appointment and the receptionist refused to give me any availability. Awful service, and awful first impression.

author: Cancer fighter
title: Excellent Care Received
body: I finally got discharged from hospital and I just want to say a big massive thank you to the HCA who helped me a lot, the lady is called Marisa. This lady gives the best washes and when you're feeling low she is there to lift you back up and makes you want to fight your illness more, she is extremely patient and her vibe says it all. Even my family that came to visit thought she was amazing at her job. I will miss Ward 624 deeply.

author: Serhm55
title: Outstanding care
body: Despite the surgery being very busy, my daughter 11 months was able to be seen by an advanced nurse practitioner Mandy for a face to face appointment. My concerns were listened to attentively and Mandy’s care, advice and reassurance was exceptional. She included my daughter in the conversation and explained what she was doing throughout to us both, of which my daughter appeared to be content and comfortable even during examination.

author: scutumxq54
title: My son's stay
body:
My son was admitted to Oak Ward and he was looked after so well.  
He was so worried about the surgery he had booked in, but they went above and beyond.  
The lady coming around with games and Lego also went down very well and kept him busy.

title: Superb treatment.
body: I cannot fault my treatment one bit with Lancashire NHS. After seeing my GP with worrying symptoms all necessary tests were carried out. One test came back abnormal, within just one week I've had my consultation, which was outstanding with the gastroenterology team at Royal Preston. I had a procedure booked for the end of the month but after speaking to a very professional lady from the gastroenterology team I was booked In for the procedure within 48hrs. With all the bad news you here on the news about hospital waiting lists etc I was considering going private so glad I didn't.  The NHS doctors, nurses and HCA's etc do an amazing job and they deserve more credit, a decent pay rise too. Thank you.

author: Rikqs54
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Advocacy is so important
body: Advocacy listen to me and that is so important. More important than people (nurses) that say they will help me when I know they just wont. This in fact is really really helpful.

author: Annmr74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you for all your care and kindness
body:
To Ann Marie and all the staff of Ward 40.  
We would like to thank you for all the care and kindness you gave my mother while in your care.You allowed us to care for her in her end of life with dignity and love.Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service
body: I visited for a blood test this morning but had a medical query as I have not been able to get an appt. The gentleman on reception was friendly and extremely helpful. Totally restored my faith in Studholm after reading so many negative messages

title: Great practice
body: I was seen by  yesterday for health check at King Edwards road.  The lady was armed with knowledge She was helpful answered all my questions. The reception and doctors are are always ever so kind and courteous . My experience was very good. I was seen on time. All in all I would also recommend Aurora Medcare.

title: Good communication
body: Booked to see Nurse who was running late due to a complex case in the previous appointment, the nurse asked one of the receptionist to let me know she was running late and would be as soon as she could… makes a big difference when you are told why you are waiting and of course understandable. The Nurse was then really lovely and apologetic when I saw her and very professional

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Coronary care is first class
body:
What can I say... The staff are just incredible! They are very happy to help, even under serious pressure. Nothing is ever too much to ask. The Domestics are lovely. Very kind. Even something simple as being asked if you would like a cup of tea. It’s the wee home comforts.  
The doctors are excellent. Everything is thoroughly explained to me and nothing is an issue.  
I didn’t think I would be here this long, but they are doing everything they can to get me on the mend. I honestly couldn’t thank the staff enough.  
I am very happy with my stay in coronary care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Really helpful and responsive
body:
In the area and needed urgent prescription - my GP is not local to South Shields.
Contacted practice and triaged within an hour.
Other practices could learn from their systems

title: Great Practice
body: The doctor was very good. He asked lots of questions and explained what medicine I should be given. He asked to see me again in one month to check that the medicine was working.

title: 20 times had to call, no answer
body: I had to call the short stay pediatric kipling unit about 20 times and nobody answered, it was quite an emergency as I need to clarify some information for my little one

title: Great Practice
body: I am always very happy with the care and support and experiences at Medwyn. Many of the staff team have worked at Medwyn for a long time, which is great.

author: Judith123
title: Excellent care at Scarborough A and E
body:
I attended Scarborough A and E with Chest pain. I was dealt with quickly by very friendly staff. All investigations done within the hour.  
The nursing staff were very helpful and caring and the doctor was very thorough and friendly explaining everything to me.  
I cannot thank them enough. I was provided with something to eat as was my husband who is a diabetic.  
When the NHS is getting a lot of flack I would like to say they are amazing and where would we be without them!

readBy.name: York Teaching Hospital NHS foundation Trust

author: Julie11
title: Treated with kindness and compassion
body:
My daughter attended Paediatric ED in the Ulster hospital after an accident. The staff were very very professional and went over and above to look after not just her but me as well.  
She was admitted to Craig Ward and the staff there were also very caring and and treated her with kindness and compassion

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dermatologist department is a disaster
body: I was told by my GP I require a skin biopsy for my severe urticaria/photosensitivity/UVRays sensitivity.when I attended they took a biopsy off my face and arm which was extremely painful. I had to chase the results myself as the dermatologist clearly missed this or couldn’t be bothered. When I got the results the findings were incorrect, irrelevant and pointless. I then went back to my GP regarding this. They spoke to the dermatologist and she was clueless as what to do next. I then asked my GP to kindly refer me to a more experienced dermatologist in another hospital as NPH Dermatologist are clueless and have zero experience. Thankfully after nearly 2 years I was referred to Guy as they diagnosed the problem immediately and gave the relevant equipment to carry out a more accurate test and diagnosis. Thank goodness I’m now in the hands of experienced dermatologists.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: novembercc79
title: I can’t explain how grateful I am
body:
I would like to extend my appreciation to the team who saw to me in the gyn day ward at QEUH. The nurse, Tammy, was so lovely and caring, she kept me distracted and calm during my ultrasound examination and is honestly such an asset.  
I can’t remember the name of the registrar who carried out the ultrasound and took my history, but she was also lovely and listened to me. After a previous referral elsewhere in 2020 where I was completely dismissed, this was really appreciated.  
And then Dr Watson, who I didn’t even need to ask for the next steps because she was already on the same page as me, I cannot begin to explain how comfortable this made me feel. As soon as I realised I didn’t have to fight my case, my guard came down and I was able to have a really healthy discussion about my next steps.  
I was absolutely dreading this appointment, so for it to go so well and to feel respected, listened to and dignified I can’t explain how grateful I am.

title: Exceptional service
body: I arrived at the practice without an appointment this morning Friday 20th.  I had a specific concern regarding an unexpected symptom.  I was seen by the Duty Doctor within 20 minutes.  He was reassuring and kind.  Thank you.

title: Hostile and uncaring
body: Several years on still unable to access any form of psychological help for my child who has several long term physical health conditions; Nobody wants to help. Unfortunatly, after many years of frequent and ongoing appointments, 'professionals' are often found to be uncaring, judgmental and incredibly unprofessional. Both my child and I dread our regular, unavoidable visits to this Notts hospital due to the continuous lack of support and hostility. What have we done to deserve this treatment? It's appalling.

author: Rosie51
title: I was comfortable throughout the whole process
body:
I was attending to have a biopsy and CT scan to confirm my cancer in preparation of a potential chemo course.  
I was looked after very well from arrival, greeted by Lucy, who looked after me throughout, and the doctor performing the biopsy was brilliant, he took great care and ensured I was comfortable throughout the whole process.  
I even left a bit earlier than I expected to go home.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: sculptordx79
title: Her struggle is getting harder each day
body: My daughter was given help at the Cullen centre October 2021. She is gravely injured ill, and would have been admitted if it wasn’t for covid, she had allocated sessions, and unfortunately stopped after the max sessions . Anorexia doesn’t stop in line with the max sessions! My daughter is in her early 20's and struggles every day, her gp has asked the Cullen centre if she could have more support, that was months ago, and have heard nothing. There is no other place in Edinburgh that can help this disorder. I’m pleading for help as her struggle is getting harder and harder each day. Please help.

title: Poor practice
body: No appointments, long waiting time, only call specific time otherwise no appointments, few hrs call back time, not busy at all but pretending busy.

title: Friendly practice
body: When entering the reception the staff we helpful and smiled when engaging.  They were happy to answer my questions and seemed happy in their workplace.

title: Great support
body: Last week I had a last minute cancellation for a blood test, but too late for me to realise. The super kind and pragmatic lead nurse fitted my test in between other appointments. And today I had a follow up with a doctor to discuss my ongoing medication. She was again super helpful and thoughtful and I was very pleased to be able to do this easily over the telephone. All in all I think the surgery really try hard to accommodate patients and make things simple.

author: Viv1crisp
title: Fabulous care experience
body:
I had been on the waiting list for an elective below knee amputation for a considerable period of time. Eventually I was transferred from orthopaedic care to the vascular team. I saw Mr Siddiqui and my amputation was done.I don't really know where to go next with this story except to say what fabulous care I received from the vascular team. Mr Sayed performed the surgery and everything seems to have gone well. And what a beautiful neat scar I have! I was very impressed. Thank you!  
The staff nurse caring for me in recovery (sorry I can't remember her name) was lovely. She was with me for ages while I waited for a bed in the ward. The staff nurses and CSW's on Ward 8 in Hairmyres were so kind. Nothing was a bother for them. I knew they were busy, but they never seemed rushed. They were all so encouraging and supportive.The domestics were also very kind. And who says hospital food isn't tasty? I enjoyed all my meals, and my little bits of cake with my tea. And I enjoyed the chat when they had time. And one of the domestics who cleaned my room had a lovely singing voice, he was lovely to listen to.A big shout out also has to go to the physio, Lyndsey, the OT Jill, and OT assistant Sam. They were amazing at helping me get started on the right path towards rehabilitation, making sure I'd be safe before being discharged home. Having a below knee amputation was the best healthcare decision I've ever made. I've been pretty much pain free since the turn of the new year. Being without pain for that length of time is unusual for me. I really appreciate everyone who respected my choice for this surgery and I'm so glad it has worked out well. I put this down to the fabulous care I received from the whole vascular team and the positive support and encouragement they gave me. Thanks everyone!

title: Brilliant care
body: My husband had his hip replaced a year ago and then a total knee replacement in December 2022. The hip was private and the knee under the nhs, the treatment was fantastic, and no different for both! The staff are really attentive and friendly, the aftercare is 5 star. I cannot recommend the Winfield highly enough, thank you for your care and support.

title: Massive improvement
body: Previous years it has been a huge struggle to get an appointment in an acceptable time and reception staff for me personally have either been too intrusive or just not really cared but the last 2 times I have made appointments I cannot fault anything I’ve been able to make face to face appointments within 24 hours. The reception staff I have spoke with have all been friendly and polite. The doctors and nurses have all listened without judgement and not just fobbed me off. My last appointment was with a nurse and she was amazing and I felt comfortable in talking to her about my mental health (not what the appointment was for) and she was so kind and listened like she genuinely cared and wanted to hear what I was rambling on about and I actually came out feeling more positive. The practice seems to be managing much better and I hope it will continue to improve.

author: Libra80
title: I cannot recommend this clinic enough!
body:
Amanda and her assistant were amazing.  
At first I was very nervous, but they were very welcoming and friendly and put me at ease. Amanda ran me through the process and the tests they were going to do. Everything was smoothly organised by her assistant. They carried out tests and Amanda even managed to bring in a specialist which was fantastic. During some of the tests they were very calm and patient with me. Personally, it was an incredible service all round. I cannot recommend this clinic enough!

author: Desyboy
title: Helpful in every aspect of my recovery
body:
I had to fight to keep my leg due to unfortunate circumstances. After major surgery, for 2 years the nurses have dressed my leg, for most of that they came to my home. Absolutely first class care, I could be getting discharged shortly. These nurses in the treatment rooms are the reason I still have my leg. Professional, caring and just helpful in every aspect of my recovery. I certainly don't want the same injury but if I did, I'd want these nurses treating me for sure.  
Anyone with negative feedback must have just had a bad day or misunderstanding because I can't praise and thank them enough.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Outstanding experience
body: I fractured my arm whilst abroad in early January and was given a plaster cast which enabled me to enjoy the remaining two weeks of my holiday. Whilst still away I contacted my GP practice to arrange a follow-up to replace the cast. RD&E responded the following day with an appointment for the day after my return. The team at the fracture clinic advised that surgery would provide me with a much more effective outcome than just replacing the cast. As a trauma injury surgery was organised for the following day. This efficiency alone was amazing given the media reports of a struggling NHS. But my praise is for the two dozen or so members of the teams I saw who all demonstrated such kindness, efficiency, support, understanding and humour over the two days. There was no sense of rush or impatience. Procedures were clearly explained and I experienced brilliant care all the way. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great practice
body: always helpful and attentive, and on last visit very attentive and doctor listened to what I had to say

author: Stevie93
title: Helped me see a different outlook
body: I have been attending Old Bridge House for Adult Psychological Therapy for some time. Just want to say a big thank you to my therapist Carmel, she has helped me see a different outlook on life and has brought me out of a difficult place.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Doctors and support
body: Came in for a vasectomy on 20/01/2023. Both doctors were fantastic, and extremely supportive and helped to create a relaxed atmosphere. Thank you very much!

author: Sarah73
title: Attendance at A&E
body:
I had been phoning GP out of hours regarding an extremely painful finger. I was on antibiotics but was worried regarding increasing pain and a black area at top of my finger. I was directed to Omagh Urgent Care and sadly had to further present to SWAH A&E.  
Thankfully Emma was on duty, and thanks to her expertise and direction I was referred to the Ulster. Once the referral process was completed, I was assessed and admitted to the Ulster for 3 nights.  
Although my finger took weeks to heal, I have no doubt that I could have lost my finger tip only for Emma. Not every practitioner I encountered actually recognised the potential consequenses of increased pain and discoloration in my finger, and I believe further training in Out of Hours and Minor Injuries is required.  
On this occasion I am forever grateful to Emma. Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: New Osler ward does not work for CF patients
body: Firstly I could not fault the amazing care I received on this ward by all the staff given the pressure they are under. Sadly the refurb fails to take into account patients that may need to stay in for a week or more like those with CF and Bronchiectasis. It falls way short of the facilities found in other CF wards such as Heartlands and The Brompton. You are unable to see out of the windows now which is incredibly depressing for patients but I presume also the staff, especially knowing how incredible and healing the views were before, so important to both mental and physical wellness. The rooms are tiny and very claustrophobic, there is nowhere to put your clothes and other belongings, There are no TVs... fine if you have access to a laptop but not everyone has this privilege...the bathrooms have no shelves, hooks or storage so any toiletries etc have to go on the floor or balance on the bin. Other CF wards have room for exercise equipment in the rooms, not a chance of that here. There is also no access to a microwave or small kitchen, again essential for CF patients especially when the food is pretty poor, the CF menu sadly was dreadful. The ward has clearly been designed for acute respiratory patients with no thought or consultation involving those with long term conditions like CF or the professionals that care for them. Were any patients consulted during the design?? It feels as though it has been designed purely for medical practicality for acute scenarios, without a thought for the holistic needs of chronic long term patients. As a CF patient I felt as though I was in a standard respiratory ward, which is something CF care has moved away from over the last decades due to our complex need and repeated lengthy admissions. I hope there can be a resolution but I presume this cost a fortune to refurb, it just feels like a terribly wasted opportunity to not have incorporated a designated CF section.

title: Diligent service
body: After many years of putting off this appointment,  finally made one & was very impressed by the time & care I was allocated. My initial phone call was also answered immediately having previously spent many times being 10th in the queue!!

title: Lovely, friendly and caring nurse and doctor
body: The nurse is amazing, lovely, caring and friendly and takes the time to explain everything properly.

author: travellerxs87
title: A fantastic service in the Dundee area
body:
My elderly father was referred to the DECS-A team by his GP, as he was struggling with a chest infection and frailty. The response was really great, we were contacted the next morning, and an initial visit by a doctor was held that day. He was given a thorough examination, and the doctor came with a selection of antibiotics, and we were given a course to start - this was fantastic that we didn't have to go to the chemist to pick up the tablets as I did not like going out and leaving dad in the house on his own.  
Over the next approx 2 weeks, we received about 6 or 7 visits from the team. The most significant was when dad was very distressed, struggling to breathe and having some seizures - I called at approx 4:45 pm, and despite the team officially stopping work at 5 pm, they agreed to call in, and a doctor and nurse practitioner were here until well after 7 pm - we were so grateful, as without them we would undoubtedly have ended up calling 999, and he would have been taken to A&E, who knows how long he would have waited to be seen, and admission would have been even more distressing for him.  
The whole concept of care-in-the-home is really fantastic, and hopefully the new DECS-A team gets the support and funding it requires to continue to flourish and provide a fantastic service in the Dundee area. Many thanks from us to Drs Din & Flatt, and to nurses Lesley and Jane.

title: Excellent service
body: I have been receiving treatment for an eye condition at Moorfields Eye hospital since Aug 2021, which was when the surgery checked me for high blood pressure cholesterol & diabetes which can the cause of my eye condition. I emailed the surgery about getting these checked again and within 11 days the test were authorised, blood taken an analysised and I have the results. Very pleased

title: Positive Feedback with QA
body:
This week I had two appointments at different clinics, Maxillofacial and Breast clinic. Both appointments were running incredibly efficient despite the high number of appointments for people in the Breast clinic! 
In between the mamagramme, ultrasound and seeing the consultant I only had to wait 10 minutes each time. 
Absolutely everyone I spoke to no matter what their job was were very kind, polite and professional!

I was so impressed I posted my experience on Facebook (Fareham Matters) which you can see. 

The response was just amazing of everyone’s positivity and praise for the entire hospital. 
Almost 350 likes from people and many reviews of experiences.

My post…

I would just like to give a shout out to QA hospital. 
I had 2 appointments in 2 different departments on Tuesday, Maxillofacial and Breast clinics. 
I was so impressed at how smoothly and efficiently the clinics were running. 
The consultants, nurses and staff were incredibly polite and helpful. 

I’m not writing this for a debate and I’m aware of waiting times for A&E and operations. I simply wanted to say thank you to any Consultants, doctors, nurses, administrators, domestic staff etc … for your dependable caring work! 
Well done QA

Many thanks indeed!
Ruth Norris (Fareham)

title: Howard Centre Hextable: Good practice
body:
The facility is local and well run. Clean, has antibacterial fluid and you can wear a mask. 

Called in on time and the clinician was welcoming. She listened to my health issue and background: medical history shared and she questioned elements of it. 

Tests were performed which were not invasive and then simple exercises to assist my injury were given. An explanation of my injury with a follow up appointment provided; text received same day as well as email of exercises on an app. 

The clinician was professional, engaging and very helpful. I look forward to seeing her again next month, hopefully with improved mobility.

author: Annabelle20
title: Staff made the experience a positive one
body: My daughter had her tonsils out. The staff were all amazing and made the experience a positive one. The sleepy doctor and surgeon were very professional and fun for a 12-year-old. There was one nurse called Chelsea on the day patient ward who stood out and made our day amazing. She was very professional, kind, helpful and sympathetic to not just my daughter but us parents too. I'd like to thank her for making it a positive experience.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Bad experience
body: Since December 2022 1st week I had an appointment in the evening and with my GP. I also like to see the same Dr as it make it easy for me to discuss my health matter. I  called for a follow up appointment due to some test I recently done and was told no apponitment is issued any more I have to called on the day for same day appointment. I have been trying at 8am and when it get to my turn no appointment available.From December to now. My last experience was this morning 20.01.2023 . I called at 7.53am line closed and you cannot hold on the phone. At exactly 8.00am I called shocking I was 14th in the queue how did that happened. By the time the receptionist got to me no appointment not only my Dr but to any Dr. I was told to called emergency Dr or111. How does that help the flow of patient have at the hospital as GP has to see patient in order to reduce on  the hospital. This system of yours is totally absurd and not working in the favour of patient. A GP practice becomes as a family DR and they know you and your health history. If an appointment was given to me as before I would already been seen by my Dr because its already been four weeks there is no common sense in thois system. Its in the fabvour of the surgery not patients. I have been with this surgery since 1983. Technology suppose to make it easy but sorry to say back in time was more easy, efficient and no stress when it comes to see your GP

author: Female Cyclist
title: Outstanding care, warmth, compassion, positive energy and kindness
body:
I got a phone call at 8:08 pm to say a friend had fallen in her home and hit her head as she fell, and that she may have broken limbs and a hurt head and was not to be moved. She had fallen at 6:30 pm and her personal alarm had alerted the first response team to a neighbour who had spare keys, then let in, when the alarm company came to her assistance. They called an ambulance at 6:45 pm and when I got to the Glasgow flat, my friend was still face down on the floor and moaning in pain.  
The team went home, and I rang 999 again and was reassured an ambulance would be there within the hour. A good team arrived at 9:50 pm, and eventually we got my friend onto a chair that they wheeled to the ambulance. We were warned we might wait outside the Queen Elizabeth Hospital Glasgow for up to six hours, as that was the current waiting time. However, someone was looking out for us, as we got a paramedic bay within 10 mins and then an A&E bay in the next 5 mins.  
My friend was given help by Dr Woo, who ordered a MRI scan for her head and an x-ray for her broken arm. My friend was vomiting every time someone touched her arm, but she was given first class service, assessment and care. The nurses, doctors on duty, and orderlies involved showed outstanding care, warmth, compassion, positive energy and kindness. I was very impressed.  
Her arm was put in plaster, every concern my friend was able to articulate was listened to and they also showed me enormous courtesy and politeness. My friend was fortunate again and found a bed on the medical ortho ward on floor ten by 4 am. I was allowed to go up with my friend, just to carry her bag and be there - we have only known each other for four years as friends, not close but her other friends were away/on holiday, etc, so I was fourth on the contact list.  
I left and got a taxi at 4:15 am. I came back on Saturday afternoon and my friend was OK - operated on and is now in respite. Jim and Jamie from Kirkintilloch ambulance station were outstanding in their care, and also Alan who wheeled Jacqueline to floor 10 was amazing. Thank you so much to the staff that night and morning and Dr Woo, and others we met who were just so nice.  
My friend kept being sick from the pain, and the morphine which she may have been allergic to - and I have not been exposed to a situation like that before but we were both constantly reassured throughout the ordeal. I have lived in Glasgow for 30 years and was so glad to be among Glaswegians on that night. Thank you.

author: Cmg
title: The children's ward staff were great
body: My 14 year old daughter was well looked after by the nurses on the children's ward, in particular Melissa, & 2 Denises. They were kind & caring with her. The Dr who clerked her in I believe was called Jamie & he was also very kind. The housekeeper kept me well fed during our time in the ward. Overall the children's ward staff were great.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: McIntyre07
title: The whole process was very straightforward from start to finish
body: I was VERY impressed with the overall service. I was met by a lovely receptionist, a lovely student radiographer, and also by a very efficient senior radiographer. The whole process was very straightforward from start to finish. The system worked so well that I was heading out the door before my appointment was even due to start. Excellent service overall. Well done, team!

author: Marydog
title: We managed to cut out A&E care for a minor injury
body:
My son had been sent home from school with a cut on his hand and I was unsure whether this required treatment or not.  
I had seen the "Know who to turn to" campaign and on the back of this called 111 (NHS24) for assessment and advice regards a minor injury.  
The call was answered quickly by a call handler who was polite and professional and then passed to a nurse who advised that this could be passed to a minor injury hub for further evaluation and to await a phone call from the latter.  
I felt reassured having gone through the questions and checks that my son was not in need of immediate treatment. My son and I were reassured by this and I also appreciated not having to wait in A&E for an indefinite time which I's sure would only increase anxiety, and my son felt safe and comfortable at home. Furthermore - I am pretty sure if we had gone to A&E he wouldn't have got assessed and signposted so quickly given the non life threatening/non urgent concern.  
I later received a phone call from a Consultant in ED, who introduced herself and further assessed the injury - it turned out that at present no further treatment was required; was given advice on how to look after the wound and when to be concerned.  
Being very aware of the current challenges on A and E in particular I also didn't feel guilty, as I would have done if I had simply turned up to ED. Thanks to all concerned.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: ScaredBoy93
title: I am very happy with the treatment I received
body:
I was very anxious leading up to the procedure, I had to have 2 wisdom teeth removed and two molars as well. I hadn’t been under general anaesthetic since I was a small child and I didn’t remember this properly, so I was terrified of what was going to happen with the anaesthetic.  
I communicated this with my nurses and the doctors and they explained to me everything that was going to happen, and explained how rare complications are from general nowadays, especially for younger, fitter people. A nurse called Emma and a nurse called Katie in particular sat with me in the waiting room before I went into the operating theatre and really helped to calm my nerves. I don’t know if I would have gone through with the day without the help and support of the nurses, and for that I am very grateful.  
As for the procedure, it seemed to go very well. I woke up in the recovery room and then was taken over to a ward for observation, which had to be a little longer than it would be normally as during the months leading up to this procedure we had discovered that I had a mild factor 11 deficiency, so the doctors and nurses just wanted to make sure everything was fine and safe. They also prescribed me a blood clotting agent.  
I am on day 2 of recovery and so far have had very little pain, just the expected discomfort. My mouth had stopped bleeding entirely by yesterday evening and now I am just taking over the counter painkillers and eating a soft diet for a few days. I am very happy with the treatment I received and would like to thank everyone who dealt with me for treating me with compassion and respect. It was a hard place to be when I was scared, but the staff made it a lot easier. Thanks again.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Mumona
title: The staff were amazing
body:
Went in today with my autistic 7 year old who had jumped onto the back end of a needle, embedding it in his foot.  
When we arrived he was in meltdown, a lot of pain, was scared and in sensory overwhelm. He didn't want to be touched at all and wouldn't allow treatment.  
The staff at Lewes Victoria were amazing. Listening to us and him, adapting and finding alternative ways to engage him, gain his trust and treat him effectively. Jess was so reassuring and friendly to him, and Helen managed to do the impossible and treat him rather than refer us on for a more complex removal, it really was impressive.  
Everyone we saw, from the health care assistants and receptionists, to the radiographers, were wonderfully calm and reassuring. We were so grateful!
